Course Details: COMPSCI 70 - Discrete Mathematics and Probability Theory
Session:
2023 Summer Session C
8 weeks, June 20 - August 11
Instructor Names: Michael  Ball, Victor  Huang, Victor H Huang, Victor Haoyang Huang, Nikki  Suzani, Nate A Tausik, Nathan A Tausik
Course description: Logic, infinity, and induction; applications include undecidability and stable marriage problem. Modular arithmetic and GCDs; applications include primality testing and cryptography. Polynomials; examples include error correcting codes and interpolation. Probability including sample spaces, independence, random variables, law of large numbers; examples include load balancing, existence arguments, Bayesian inference.
Note:
* Time conflicts ALLOWED with this class.

* Attendance is not mandatory. Lecture will be recorded for playback later.

* Remote option offered (in addition to in person) for exams.

*To enroll in this class, select the lecture and the 999 (placeholder) discussion sections. Assignment to the ACTUAL discussion sections will be managed by teaching staff during the first class.*

* Email CS70-staff@berkeley.edu to reach instructors.
